main event: An object appeared to hover and extinguish rapidly near Kasumiga-ura, Japan on December 9, 1960.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 20 minutes, The object had a spherical shape and was bright firey red, The sighting may have been a psychological case with no available evidence indicating the object's physical existence, Commanding officer suggested it could have been a meteor, The sighting included a naval message confirming an experienced officer's observation.
witness description: Lieutenant Junior Grade A. H. Clark and Junior Officer of the Deck V. A. Walker, both considered reliable and experienced.
